availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Branch of the United States Army devoted to carrying for sick and wounded soldiers. Headquartered in Washington, D.C. Led by the Surgeon General of the United States Army. Civil War-era Surgeon Generals: Clement Finley (1861-1862); William A. Hammond (1862-1864); Joseph Barnes (1864-1865).

ab.bibl:
George Washington Adams, Doctors in Blue: The Medical History of the Union Army in the Civil War (Baton Rouge: Louisiana State University Press, 1980).
Mary C. Gillett, The Army Medical Department: 1818-1865 (Washington, DC: U.S. Government Printing Office, 1987).
